meanings.definition: The state or condition of being woe.
meanings.sent1: Her face showed deep woenesses after hearing the sad news.
meanings.sent2: The woenesses in his voice revealed the pain he was feeling.
meanings.sent3: Despite the woenesses of the situation, she tried to stay positive.
meanings.sent4: The woenesses of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The woenesses of loss weighed heavily on his heart.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of causing sorrow or distress.
meanings.sent1: The movie portrayed the woenesses of war with heartbreaking scenes.
meanings.sent2: His actions brought woenesses to those around him.
meanings.sent3: The woenesses of the burnt cookies made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The woenesses of betrayal cut deeper than any physical wound.
meanings.sent5: The woenesses of the melody touched the audience's hearts.
